Uses a rock to strike Cady and stun him when being drowned, showing quick thinking and resourcefulness.
Drops his revolver during the struggle, losing his weapon.
Runs toward the cabin and instructs Nancy to run and hide, showing protective instincts and quick decision-making.
Seizes Nancy and pushes her into safety, urging her to run and hide.
Seizes Nancy and almost pushes her into safety of the undergrowth, showing quick protective instincts.
Picks up a heavy barbecue poker and confronts Cady as he reaches the porch steps, demonstrating readiness to defend.
After losing the poker, quickly rises and seeks shelter in the undergrowth, showing situational awareness and adaptability.
Crawls silently forward toward the revolver, attempting to arm himself again, indicating tactical thinking and stealth.
Unaware of Cady's silent approach despite being stalked closely, indicating a lapse in vigilance.
Scrambles to escape Cady's attack, uses environment to hide and survive.
Does not retaliate aggressively but focuses on evasion and survival.
Glances at the raised poker just in time and scrambles to his feet, narrowly avoiding a deadly blow.
Moves quickly through difficult terrain, using undergrowth and tall grass to conceal himself while edging toward the revolver.
Almost reaches the revolver but has to roll aside at the last moment to avoid another attack, showing quick reflexes.
Conceals himself effectively in long grass despite Cady's savage attempts to find him, demonstrating stealth and patience.
Pressured against the far bank and seemingly at mercy, unable to escape or counterattack immediately.
Hesitates before shooting Cady, chooses to incapacitate rather than kill him.
Speaks to Cady with a mix of sternness and grim compassion, promising to nurse him back to health despite his crimes.
Uses a desperate gamble to reach the revolver and successfully shoots Cady despite being hit.
Hesitates before shooting Cady at point-blank range, showing controlled restraint and strategic thinking.
Decides to keep Cady alive and ensure he is imprisoned rather than killing him outright.
Sits quietly with Peggy and Nancy, sharing a moment of calm and slight smiles, showing care and concern for Nancy's well-being.
